Package com.dua3.utility.text

Record Class MessageFormatter.MessageFormatterStringFormat

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Record
com.dua3.utility.text.MessageFormatter.MessageFormatterStringFormat
Record Components:
locale - the Locale to use
All Implemented Interfaces:
MessageFormatter
Enclosing interface:
MessageFormatter
public static record MessageFormatter.MessageFormatterStringFormat(Locale locale) extends Record implements MessageFormatter
The MessageFormatterStringFormat class is an implementation of the MessageFormatter interface that uses the String.format(Locale, String, Object...) method for formatting messages. It allows for localized formatting based on a specified Locale.

The formatting operation takes a format string and a list of arguments, replacing placeholders in the format string with the corresponding values of the arguments.

This class is immutable and thread-safe.

      Formats the given format string by replacing placeholders with the provided arguments.

      NOTE: The formatting process is implementation defined.

      Specified by:

    • getFormatStyle

      public MessageFormatter.FormatStyle getFormatStyle()
      Description copied from interface: MessageFormatter
      Retrieves the formatting style currently in use by the MessageFormatter.

      The formatting style determines the approach taken for formatting messages or processing text input, see MessageFormatter.FormatStyle for details.
